p: With these caveats in mind, several important concepts are emerging. One of the major advancements in our understanding is that aneuploidies transmitted from gametes do not appear to affect preimplantation development. However, the early embryonic divisions themselves are remarkably unstable [140], [141], [142], and may in part be due to spindle instability [141], [143] during the maternal-to-zygotic transition. As a consequence, this may give rise to diverse patterns of aneuploidy as well as mosaicism throughout the embryo [140], [144].
